bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, December 23, 1918

div1.p: Blue sends Carter to New Orleans, Louisiana, and Memphis, Tennessee, to plan for a malaria investigation.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, December 23, 1918
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
IN.
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
December 23, 1918.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
In connection with your investigations of malaria
and as your other duties permit, you will proceed to
New Orleans, Louisiana, Memphis, Tennessee and such
other points as may be necessary, with a view to
investigating the feasibility and availability of sites
for an office for the malaria investigations.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. Jns
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
JHMoyle
Assistant Secretary.
RB
